article.headline: Idaho State 95, Montana 70
article.story: POCATELLO, Idaho (AP) -- Senior center Slim Millien had 25 points, nine rebounds and five blocked shots, and junior guard Ryan Baumgartner added a career-high 22 points and six assists to lead Idaho State to a 95-70 rout of Montana on Saturday. Montana (16-5, 6-3 Big Sky) only made four of its first 14 shots in the opening eight minutes. Idaho State (10-11, 2-7 Big Sky) turned it over six times during that same stretch. Montana finally got some breathing room midway through the half, going on a 7-0 run to grab a 22-16 lead. With 3:38 left in the half, Montana's Matt Dlouhy was called for a flagrant foul on ISU's Logan Kinghorn as Kinghorn drove into the lane. Kinghorn landed hard on the floor and lay motionless for about 30 seconds, then got up and headed toward the Montana bench. Officials gave Kinghorn a technical foul as his teammates restrained him. Kinghorn then seemed to collapse at half court and was down for nearly five minutes before being slowly helped to his feet. Officials ejected both Dlouhy and Kinghorn. Montana took a 40-34 lead into the locker room at halftime. ISU started the second half with a 9-2 run to take a 43-42 lead. At the 14:39 mark, Montana's Andrew Strait scored a basket inside to give UM what proved to be their last lead at 48-46. Idaho State blew the game wide open over the next 10 minutes, outscoring Montana 38-8 and holding UM without a field goal during that stretch, putting the game out of reach at 84-56. Montana made only six field goals in the second half, and went 0-9 from three-point range during that time. Both teams cleared their benches for the last four minutes of the game. Strait led Montana with 16 points and eight rebounds and Jordan Hasquet added 11 points.

statistics.name: points
statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.name: fieldGoals
statistics.description: Field Goal makes and attempts.

statistics.name: freeThrows
statistics.description: Free Throw makes and attempts.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.name: minutes
statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.name: assistTurnoverRatio
statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover

statistics.description: The total number of rebounds (offensive and defensive).

statistics.description: The number of times when the defense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot by the offense.
